lines.text: Adobe Acrobat supports a range of solutions for electronic and digital signatures . These
solutions include certificate signatures that let you sign PDF files with a certificate-based

spans.text: solutions include certificate signatures that let you sign PDF files with a certificate-based

lines.text: digital ID. Certificate signatures are also known as digital signatures. Acrobat lets you create

spans.text: digital ID. Certificate signatures are also known as digital signatures. Acrobat lets you create

lines.text: your certificate ID. However, the common approach is to work with a certificate ID from a

spans.text: your certificate ID. However, the common approach is to work with a certificate ID from a

lines.text: trusted third-party certificate authority. Additional signing options in Acrobat include

spans.text: trusted third-party certificate authority. Additional signing options in Acrobat include

lines.text: integration with Adobe Acrobat Sign .
Why use certificate signatures?
Many business transactions, including financial, legal, and other regulated transactions,

spans.text: Many business transactions, including financial, legal, and other regulated transactions,

lines.text: require high assurance when signing documents. When documents are distributed

spans.text: require high assurance when signing documents. When documents are distributed

lines.text: electronically, it's important that recipients can:

spans.text: electronically, it's important that recipients can:

lines.text: Verify document authenticity—confirming the identity of each person who signed the

spans.text: Verify document authenticity—confirming the identity of each person who signed the

lines.text: document
Verify document integrity—confirming that the document has not been altered in

spans.text: Verify document integrity—confirming that the document has not been altered in

lines.text: transit
Certificate-based signatures provide both of these security services. Many businesses and

spans.text: Certificate-based signatures provide both of these security services. Many businesses and

lines.text: governments have chosen to set up a certificate-based digital signature infrastructure within

spans.text: governments have chosen to set up a certificate-based digital signature infrastructure within

lines.text: their organization. They use third-party certificate authorities to provide independent identity

spans.text: their organization. They use third-party certificate authorities to provide independent identity

lines.text: validation. Examples include:
For instance, companies in the European Union who need to comply with advanced or

spans.text: For instance, companies in the European Union who need to comply with advanced or

lines.text: qualified electronic signature requirements in eIDAS e-signature regulation or the ETSI PAdES
standard (PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures).
What can I do with certificate IDs?

spans.text: What can I do with certificate IDs?

lines.text: Once certificate-based digital IDs have been provided to end users, they can

spans.text: Once certificate-based digital IDs have been provided to end users, they can

lines.text: use Acrobat or Acrobat Reader software to sign PDF files and validate files they receive from

spans.text: software to sign PDF files and validate files they receive from

lines.text: others.
Sign documents
Sign PDF files using certificate IDs

spans.text: Sign PDF files using certificate IDs
